channel.title: [PI]How do I connect to the server i am coding for through the source?[PI]
channel.description: Well I started coding for this server and the owner sent me his source and client and all the changes I make don't apply, And things that were added on the server don't appear in my source. how do I change this?

item.title: [PI]How do I connect to the server i am coding for through the source?[PI]
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“bob2568, post:9, topic:520606”]in case you didnt understand exactly what sk8r is saying ill explain…

Open My computer, or computer. Goto your C:\ drive, program files or program files (x86) if you have windows 7. & you should see java, click it and open jdk, then copy the link in your address bar at the top and paste it into your compiler… if you dont have jdk here you go http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/java/javase/downloads/jdk7-downloads-1880260.html[/quote]
You explained that paritally wrong. If you have a 64 bit computer, you have 2 different program files folders.
Program Files - This one holds all the 64-Bit programs.
Program Files (x86) - This one holds the 32-bit programs.

Read full topic
item.source: [PI]How do I connect to the server i am coding for through the source?[PI]

item.dc:creator: @bob2568 bob2568
item.description:
@bob2568 wrote:

in case you didnt understand exactly what sk8r is saying ill explain…

Open My computer, or computer. Goto your C:\ drive, program files or program files (x86) if you have windows 7. & you should see java, click it and open jdk, then copy the link in your address bar at the top and paste it into your compiler… if you dont have jdk here you go http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/java/javase/downloads/jdk7-downloads-1880260.html

item.title: [PI]How do I connect to the server i am coding for through the source?[PI]
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Change this:
“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.7.0_21\bin\javac.exe”

To your JDK version.

Read full topic
item.source: [PI]How do I connect to the server i am coding for through the source?[PI]

item.title: [PI]How do I connect to the server i am coding for through the source?[PI]
item.dc:creator: @BrodsBruin BrodsBruin
item.description:
@BrodsBruin wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:6, topic:520606”][quote author=BrodsBruin link=topic=639105.msg4308470#msg4308470 date=1370323888]
And i do that how? im new to coding.
[/quote]
What’s your compiler code?
Right click > Edit >copy everything > post here[/quote]
@echo off
“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.7.0_21\bin\javac.exe” -classpath deps/log4j-1.2.15.jar;deps/jython.jar;deps/xstream.jar;deps/mina.jar;deps/mysql.jar;deps/poi.jar;deps/slf4j.jar;deps/slf4j-nop.jar -d bin src\server\event*.java src\server\model\items*.java src\server\model\minigames*.java src\server\model\npcs*.java src\server\model\objects*.java src\server\model\players*.java src\server\model\players\skills*.java src\server\model\players\packets*.java src\server\model\shops*.java src\server\net*.java src\server\task*.java src\server\util*.java src\server\world*.java src\server\util\log*.java src\server*.java src\server\world\map*.java
pause

Read full topic
